definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: The resolution was acclaimed with one voice.
sentences.chinese: 決議博得滿場異口同聲的歡呼。

sentences.english: This skill earned him the nicknames "Air Jordan" and "His Airness.
sentences.chinese: 這個技術爲他博得了飛人喬丹和空中傳奇的綽號。

sentences.english: He was respected for his learning by several churchmen and other gentlemen.
sentences.chinese: 學識博得了一些牧師和其他紳士們的尊敬。

sentences.english: Third, the prestige that comes with success commands respect.
sentences.chinese: 第三，伴隨成功而來的威望可以博得尊重。
她以阿諛奉承博得寵幸。

sentences.english: The excellent acrobatic performance brought down the house.
sentences.chinese: 精采的雜技表演博得全場喝采。

sentences.english: The grand opera has really clicked with young people.
sentences.chinese: 這出大歌劇博得年輕人的好評。

sentences.english: The lawyer's cogent arguments convince the jury.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師強有力的爭辯博得陪審團之信服。

sentences.english: He was tonguing the apple to get a laugh from his classmates.
sentences.chinese: 他用舌頭舔着蘋果，以博得同學們的笑聲。

sentences.english: The performance met with general applause.
Their deadly style has earned them respect from other martial artists.
sentences.chinese: 他們致命的打法爲他們博得其它武術家的尊敬。

sentences.english: She gave me a smile in exchange for my help.
sentences.chinese: 我幫了她一忙博得了她的莞爾一笑。

sentences.english: Much of the money in the meeting talented show command everyone praise.
sentences.chinese: 錢多多在會議上的超卓顯示博得人人的一致讚賞。

sentences.english: To compliment excessively and often insincerely especially in order to win favor.
sentences.chinese: 尤指爲了博得歡心的過分地且常常爲不真誠地讚揚。

sentences.english: IK looked back to see if the headless man has stopped.
sentences.chinese: 伊卡博得朝後看了看那個無頭人是否停下來了。

sentences.english: Rather king but can triumph agreeable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 寧王卻可以博得一個好名聲。

definition: everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to capture (enemy property or personnel)/capture (physics: absorption of subatomic particle by an atom or nucleus)
